definition: to force (sb to do sth)/to compel/to press for/to extort/to press on towards/to press up to/to close in on/euphemistic variant of 屄[bi1]

sentences.english: It says they also tried to silence the victims' relatives with bribes and threats.
sentences.chinese: 并且威逼利诱受难者家属保持沉默。

sentences.english: They threatened him with a lawsuit.
Tian Master heard here, no longer spend money into the father.
sentences.chinese: 田少爷听到这里，不再威逼花父还钱。

sentences.english: The police could not browbeat him into confessing.
sentences.chinese: 警察怎样威逼他也没法使他招认。

sentences.english: Mingming later meets Jiahui and forces her to poison Jinsheng.
sentences.chinese: 其后，明明再与嘉惠会面，并威逼她向金生下毒。

sentences.english: People were stripped of their coat and shoes at knife-point on the street.
sentences.chinese: 在街上，人们被刀威逼着脱下外套和鞋子。

sentences.english: The hoodlums strong-armed me into giving them my wallet.
sentences.chinese: 那些流氓威逼我交出钱包给他们。

sentences.english: When forty winters shall besiege thy brow.
sentences.chinese: 四十个严冬威逼着你的青春面容。

sentences.english: Two hundred thousand QinBing follow, the threat is too great.
sentences.chinese: 两十万秦卒跟随，威逼实在太大了。

sentences.english: The aggressive Mr Jager tended to intimidate employees.
sentences.chinese: 行事激进的雅格先生倾向于威逼员工。

sentences.english: The boss browbeat me into taking on all this extra work.
sentences.chinese: 老板威逼我接受所有这个额外的工作。

definition: to use gain as a lure
use both carrot and stick/use gentle methods and force/an iron hand in a velvet glove
forced submission/to exploit advantage to force sb to do one's bidding
